steps.text: Ensure that POWER EV-1 and 2 are set to Off
Ensure that POWER EV-1 and 2 EMU LEDs are OFF
Ensure that WATER SUPPLY EV-1 and 2 is set to CLOSE
Ensure that OXYGEN EV-1 and 2 are set to CLOSE
Depressurize the UIA O2 supply lines by switching O2 Vent to OPEN
When UIA Supply Press is less than 23 psi, proceed.
Set O2 Vent to CLOSE
Pressurize EVA 1 by checking that O2 VENT is set to CLOSED
Switch OXYGEN EV-1 to OPEN
When UIA Supply Press is greater than 3000 psi and stable, proceed.
Depressurize EVA 1 by switching OXYGEN EV-1 to CLOSE
Switch O2 Vent to OPEN
When UIA Supply Pressure is less than 23 and stable psi, proceed.
REPEAT: Pressurize EVA 1 by checking that O2 VENT is set to CLOSED
REPEAT: Switch OXYGEN EV-1 to OPEN
REPEAT: When UIA Supply Press is greater than 3000 psi and stable, proceed.
REPEAT: Depressurize EVA 1 by switching OXYGEN EV-1 to CLOSE
REPEAT: Switch O2 Vent to OPEN
REPEAT: When UIA Supply Pressure is less than 23 and stable psi, proceed.
Pressurize EVA 1 by checking that O2 VENT is set to CLOSED
Switch OXYGEN EV-1 to OPEN
When UIA Supply Press is greater than 3000 psi and stable, proceed.
Close OXYGEN by switching OXYGEN EV-1 to CLOSE
Enable EV-1 to power up EMU by checking that UIA POWER EV-1 is set to OFF
Check that UIA POWER EV-1 EMU LED is OFF
Check that O2 supply press gauge is greater than 3000
Switch DCU POWER to BATT
Switch UIA POWER EV-1 to ON
steps.subtext: EMU must be ON battery power when UIA suit POWER is turned ON

steps.text: Check that EV-1 EMU LED is ON
Don the EMU by affixing DCU to body
Prepare DCU by switching DCU POWER to SCU
Switch DCU FAN to PRI
Switch DCU RCA TO CO2
Switch Secondary O2 to OFF
Switch PUMP to PRI
Switch AUX LTC to ON
Proceed to Translation Procedures
